 1981:     {Rows, _} = get_window_size(Term),
 1982: 
 1983:     %% We send a lot of newlines here in order for the number of rows
 1984:     %% in the window to be max so that we can predict what the cursor
 1985:     %% position is.
 1986:     [send_tty(Term,"\n") || _ <- lists:seq(1, Rows)],
 1987: 
 1988:     %% We enter an 'a' here so that we can get the correct orig position
 1989:     %% with an alternative prompt.
 1990:     send_tty(Term,"a.\n"),
 1991:     check_content(Term,"2>$"),
 1992:     OrigLocation = get_location(Term),
 1993:     Term#tmux{ orig_location = OrigLocation }.
 1994: 
 1995: prompt(L) ->
 1996:     N = proplists:get_value(history, L, 0),
 1997:     Fun = application:get_env(stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test,
 1998:                               fun() -> atom_to_list(node()) end),
 1999:     io_lib:format("(~ts)~w> ",[Fun(),N]).
 2000: 
 2001: stop_tty(Term) ->
 2002:     catch peer:stop(Term#tmux.peer),
 2003:     ct:log("~ts",[get_content(Term, "-e")]),
 2004:     [ct:log("~ts",[get_content(Term#tmux{ name = Term#tmux.ssh_server_name }, "-e")])
 2005:       || Term#tmux.ssh_server_name =/= undefined],
 2006: %    "" = tmux("kill-window -t " ++ Term#tmux.name),
 2007:     ok.
 2008: 
 2009: tty_name(Term) ->
 2010:     Term#tmux.name.
 2011: 
 2012: send_tty(Term, "Home") ->
 2013:     %% https://stackoverflow.com/a/55616731
 2014:     send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 2015:     send_tty(Term,"OH");
 2016: send_tty(Term, "End") ->
 2017:     send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 2018:     send_tty(Term,"OF");
 2019: send_tty(#tmux{ name = Name } = _Term,Value) ->
 2020:     [Head | Quotes] = string:split(Value, "'", all),
 2021:     "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " '" ++ Head ++ "'"),
 2022:     [begin
 2023:          "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " \"'\""),
 2024:          "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " '" ++ V ++ "'")
 2025:      end || V <- Quotes].
 2026: 
 2027: %% We use send_stdin for testing of things that we cannot sent via
 2028: %% the tmux send command, such as invalid unicode
 2029: send_stdin(Term, Chars) when is_binary(Chars) ->
 2030:     rpc(Term,erlang,display_string,[stdin,Chars]);
 2031: send_stdin(Term, Chars) ->
 2032:     send_stdin(Term, iolist_to_binary(unicode:characters_to_binary(Chars))).
 2033: 
 2034: check_location(Term, Where) ->
 2035:     check_location(Term, Where, 5).
 2036: check_location(Term, Where, Attempt) when is_tuple(Where) ->
 2037:     check_location(Term, [Where], Attempt);
 2038: check_location(#tmux{ orig_location = {OrigRow, OrigCol} = Orig } = Term,
 2039:                Where, Attempt) ->
 2040:     NewLocation = get_location(Term),
 2041:     case lists:any(fun({AdjRow, AdjCol}) ->
 2042:                            {OrigRow+AdjRow,OrigCol+AdjCol} =:= NewLocation
 2043:                    end, Where) of
 2044:         true -> NewLocation;
 2045:         false when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 2046:             {NewRow, NewCol} = NewLocation,
 2047:             ct:fail({wrong_location, {expected,Where},
 2048:                      {got,{NewRow - OrigRow, NewCol - OrigCol},
 2049:                       {NewLocation, Orig}}});
 2050:         false ->
 2051:             timer:sleep(50),
 2052:             check_location(Term, Where, Attempt -1)
 2053:     end.
 2054: 
 2055: get_location(Term) ->
 2056:     RowAndCol = tmux("display -pF '#{cursor_y} #{cursor_x}' -t "++Term#tmux.name),
 2057:     [Row, Col] = string:lexemes(string:trim(RowAndCol,both)," "),
 2058:     {list_to_integer(Row), list_to_integer(Col)}.
 2059: 
 2060: get_window_size(Term) ->
 2061:     RowAndCol = tmux("display -pF '#{window_height} #{window_width}' -t "++Term#tmux.name),
 2062:     [Row, Col] = string:lexemes(string:trim(RowAndCol,both)," "),
 2063:     {list_to_integer(Row), list_to_integer(Col)}.
 2064: 
 2065: check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch) ->
 2066:     check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, #{}, 5).
 2067: check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, Opts, Attempt) ->
 2068:     Opts = #{},
 2069:     OrigContent = case Term of
 2070:         #tmux{} -> get_content(Term);
 2071:         Fun when is_function(Fun,0) -> Fun()
 2072:     end,
 2073:     Content = case maps:find(replace, Opts) of
 2074:                 {ok, {RE,Repl} } ->
 2075:                     re:replace(OrigContent, RE, Repl, [global]);
 2076:                 error ->
 2077:                     OrigContent
 2078:                 end,
 2079:     case re:run(string:trim(Content, both), lists:flatten(NegativeMatch), [unicode]) of
 2080:         {match,_} ->
 2081:             io:format("Failed, found '~ts' in ~n'~ts'~n",
 2082:             [unicode:characters_to_binary(NegativeMatch), Content]),
 2083:             io:format("Failed, found '~w' in ~n'~w'~n",
 2084:                         [unicode:characters_to_binary(NegativeMatch), Content]),
 2085:             ct:fail(match);
 2086:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 2087:             ok;
 2088:         _ ->
 2089:             timer:sleep(500),
 2090:             check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, Opts, Attempt - 1)
 2091:     end.
 2092: check_content(Term, Match) ->
 2093:     check_content(Term, Match, #{}).
 2094: check_content(Term, Match, Opts) when is_map(Opts) ->
 2095:     check_content(Term, Match, Opts, 5).
 2096: check_content(Term, Match, Opts, Attempt) ->
 2097:     OrigContent = case Term of
 2098:                   #tmux{} -> get_content(Term);
 2099:                   Fun when is_function(Fun,0) -> Fun()
 2100:               end,
 2101:     Content = case maps:find(replace, Opts) of
 2102:                   {ok, {RE,Repl} } ->
 2103:                       re:replace(OrigContent, RE, Repl, [global]);
 2104:                   error ->
 2105:                       OrigContent
 2106:               end,
 2107:     case re:run(string:trim(Content, both), lists:flatten(Match), [unicode]) of
 2108:         {match,_} ->
 2109:             ok;
 2110:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 2111:             io:format("Failed to find '~ts' in ~n'~ts'~n",
 2112:                       [unicode:characters_to_binary(Match), Content]),
 2113:             io:format("Failed to find '~w' in ~n'~w'~n",
 2114:                       [unicode:characters_to_binary(Match), Content]),
 2115:             ct:fail(nomatch);
 2116:         _ ->
 2117:             timer:sleep(500),
 2118:             check_content(Term, Match, Opts, Attempt - 1)
 2119:     end.
 2120: 
 2121: get_content(Term) ->
 2122:     get_content(Term, "").
 2123: get_content(#tmux{ name = Name }, Args) ->
 2124:     Content = unicode:characters_to_binary(tmux("capture-pane -p " ++ Args ++ " -t " ++ Name)),
 2125:     case string:split(Content,"a.\na") of
 2126:         [_Ignore,C] ->
 2127:             C;
 2128:         [C] ->
 2129:             C
 2130:     end.
 2131: 
 2132: %% Tests that exit of initial shell restarts shell.
 2133: exit_initial(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2134:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2135: 	old ->
 2136:             test_exit_initial(old);
 2137:         new ->
 2138:             test_exit_initial(old),
 2139:             test_exit_initial(new)
 2140:     end,
 2141:     ok.
 2142: 
 2143: test_exit_initial(old) ->
 2144:     rtnode:run(
 2145:       [{putline, ""},
 2146:        {putline, "2."},
 2147:        {expect, "2\r\n"},
 2148:        {putline, "exit()."},
 2149:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2150:        {putline, ""},
 2151:        {putline, "35."},
 2152:        {expect, "35\r\n"}],
 2153:       [], [], ["-oldshell"]);
 2154: test_exit_initial(new) ->
 2155:     rtnode:run(
 2156:       [{putline, ""},
 2157:        {expect, "1> $"},
 2158:        {putline, "2."},
 2159:        {expect, "2"},
 2160:        {putline,"exit()."},
 2161:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2162:        {expect, "1> $"},
 2163:        {putline, "35."},
 2164:        {expect, "35\r\n"}]).
 2165: 
 2166: stop_during_init(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2167:     {RunErl,_ToErl,[Erl|ErlArgs]} = rtnode:get_progs(),
 2168:     case rtnode:create_tempdir() of
 2169:         {error, Reason} ->
 2170:             {skip, Reason};
 2171:         Tempdir ->
 2172:             XArg = " -kernel shell_history enabled -s init stop",
 2173:             rtnode:start_runerl_command(RunErl, Tempdir, "\\\""++Erl++"\\\""++ErlArgs++XArg),
 2174:             Logs = rtnode:read_logs(Tempdir),
 2175:             rtnode:dump_logs(Logs),
 2176:             nomatch = binary:match(map_get("erlang.log.1", Logs),
 2177:                                    <<"*** ERROR: Shell process terminated! ***">>),
 2178:             ok
 2179:     end.
 2180: 
 2181: %% This testcase tests that the correct wrapping characters are added
 2182: %% When a terminal has the xn flag set, it means that wrapping may not
 2183: %% work as expected and historically the ttysl driver has always inserted
 2184: %% a " \b" (i.e. space + backspace) when an output string ends on that line
 2185: %% in order for the cursor to be at col 0 on the next line instead of col max
 2186: %% on the current line.
 2187: %%
 2188: %% This caused problems when a string was `columns` long and then ended in "\r\n"
 2189: %% as it would first wrap due to " \b" and then output "\r\n" that cause a double
 2190: %% newline to happen.
 2191: %%
 2192: %% This testcase tests that we get a " \b" when we should and we get a "\r\n" when
 2193: %% we should.
 2194: wrap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2195:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2196:         new ->
 2197:             As = lists:duplicate(20,"a"),
 2198:             rtnode:run(
 2199:               [{putline, "io:columns()."},
 2200:                {expect, "{ok,20}\r\n"},
 2201:                {putline, ["io:format(\"~s\",[lists:duplicate(20,\"a\")])."]},
 2202:                {expect, As ++ " \b"},
 2203:                {putline, ["io:format(\"~s~n~s\",[lists:duplicate(20,\"a\"),lists:duplicate(20,\"a\")])."]},
 2204:                {expect, As ++ "\r\n" ++ As ++ " \b"}
 2205:               ],
 2206:               [],
 2207:               "stty rows 40; stty columns 20; ");
 2208:         _ ->
 2209:             ok
 2210:     end,
 2211:     ok.
 2212: 
 2213: noshell_raw(Config) ->
 2214: 
 2215:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2216:         new ->
 2217: 
 2218:             TCGl = group_leader(),
 2219:             TC = self(),
 2220: 
 2221:             TestcaseFun = fun() ->
 2222:                                   link(TC),
 2223:                                   group_leader(whereis(user), self()),
 2224: 
 2225:                                   try
 2226:                                     %% Make sure we are in unicode encoding
 2227:                                     unicode = proplists:get_value(encoding, io:getopts()),
 2228: 
 2229:                                     %% "\el" is an artifact from the attaching to_erl program
 2230:                                     "\el" ++ "hello\n" = io:get_line("1> "),
 2231:                                     io:format(TCGl, "TC Line: ~p~n", [?LINE]),
 2232:                                     ok = shell:start_interactive({noshell, raw}),
 2233: 
 2234:                                     io:format(TCGl, "TC Line: ~p~n", [?LINE]),
 2235: 
 2236:                                     %% Test that we can receive 1 char when N is 100
 2237:                                     [$\^p] = io:get_chars("2> ", 100),
 2238: 
 2239:                                     io:format(TCGl, "TC Line: ~p~n", [?LINE]),
 2240: 
 2241:                                     %% Test that we only receive 1 char when N is 1
 2242:                                     "a" = io:get_chars("3> ", 1),
 2243:                                     "bc" = io:get_chars("", 2),
 2244: 
 2245:                                     io:format(TCGl, "TC Line: ~p~n", [?LINE]),
 2246: 
 2247:                                     %% Test that get_chars counts characters not bytes
 2248:                                     ok = io:setopts([binary]),
 2249:                                     ~b"" = io:get_chars("4> ", 1),
 2250:                                     ~b"" = io:get_chars("", 2),
 2251: 
 2252:                                     io:format(TCGl, "TC Line: ~p~n", [?LINE]),
 2253: 
 2254:                                     %% Test that echo works
 2255:                                     ok = io:setopts([{echo, true}]),
 2256:                                     ~b"" = io:get_chars("5> ", 100),
 2257:                                     ok = io:setopts([{echo, false}]),
 2258: 
 2259:                                     io:format(TCGl, "TC Line: ~p~n", [?LINE]),
 2260: 
 2261:                                     %% Test that get_line works
 2262:                                     ~b"a\n" = io:get_line("6> "),
 2263: 
 2264:                                     io:format(TCGl, "TC Line: ~p~n", [?LINE]),
 2265: 
 2266:                                     %% Test that get_until works
 2267:                                     ok = io:setopts([{echo, true}]),
 2268:                                     ~b"a,b,c" = io:request({get_until, unicode, "7> ", ?MODULE, get_until, []}),
 2269:                                     ok = io:setopts([{echo, false}]),
 2270: 
 2271:                                     io:format(TCGl, "TC Line: ~p~n", [?LINE]),
 2272: 
 2273:                                     %% Test that we can go back to cooked mode
 2274:                                     ok = shell:start_interactive({noshell, cooked}),
 2275:                                     io:format(TCGl, "TC Line: ~p~n", [?LINE]),
 2276:                                     ~b"abc" = io:get_chars(user, "8> ", 3),
 2277:                                     io:format(TCGl, "TC Line: ~p~n", [?LINE]),
 2278:                                     ~b"\n" = io:get_chars(user, "", 1),
 2279: 
 2280:                                     io:format("exit")
 2281:                                   catch E:R:ST ->
 2282:                                     io:format(TCGl, "~p", [{E, R, ST}])
 2283:                                   end
 2284:                           end,
 2285: 
 2286:             rtnode:run(
 2287:               [
 2288:                {eval, fun() -> spawn(TestcaseFun), ok end},
 2289: 
 2290:                %% Test io:get_line in cookec mode
 2291:                {expect, "1> $"},
 2292:                {putline, "hello"},
 2293: 
 2294:                %% Test io:get_chars 100 in  raw mode
 2295:                {expect, "2> $"},
 2296:                {putdata, [$\^p]},
 2297: 
 2298:                %% Test io:get_chars 1 in raw mode
 2299:                {expect, "3> $"},
 2300:                {putdata, "abc"},
 2301: 
 2302:                %% Test io:get_chars unicode
 2303:                {expect, "4> $"},
 2304:                {putdata, ~b""},
 2305: 
 2306:                %% Test that raw + echo works
 2307:                {expect, "5> $"},
 2308:                {putdata, ~b""},
 2309:                {expect, "$"},
 2310: 
 2311:                %% Test io:get_line in raw mode
 2312:                {expect, "6> $"},
 2313:                {putdata, "a\r"}, %% When in raw mode, \r is newline.
 2314: 
 2315:                %% Test io:get_until in raw mode
 2316:                {expect, "7> $"},
 2317:                {putline, "a"},
 2318:                {expect, "a\n7> $"},
 2319:                {putline, "b"},
 2320:                {expect, "b\n7> $"},
 2321:                {putdata, "c."},
 2322:                {expect, "c.$"},
 2323: 
 2324:                %% Test io:get_line in cooked mode
 2325:                {expect, "8> $"},
 2326:                {putdata, "a"},
 2327:                {expect, "a"},
 2328:                {putdata, "b"},
 2329:                {expect, "b"},
 2330:                {putline, "c"},
 2331:                {expect, "c\r\n$"},
 2332: 
 2333:                {expect, "exit$"}
 2334:               ], [], [],
 2335:               ["-noshell","-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]);
 2336:         _ -> ok
 2337:     end,
 2338:     ok.
 2339: 
 2340: get_until(start, NewChars) ->
 2341:     get_until([], NewChars);
 2342: get_until(State, NewChars) ->
 2343:     Chars = State ++ NewChars,
 2344:     case string:split(Chars, ".") of
 2345:         [Chars] -> {more, Chars ++ ","};
 2346:         [Before, After] -> {done, [C || C <- Before, C =/= $\n], After}
 2347:     end.
 2348: 
 2349: 
 2350: %% This testcase tests that shell_history works as it should.
 2351: %% We use Ctrl + P = Cp=[$\^p] in order to navigate up
 2352: %% We use Ctrl + N = Cp=[$\^n] in order to navigate down
 2353: %% We use Ctrl + B = Cp=[$\^b] in order to navigate left
 2354: %% in the console. We also need to sleep for a while in order
 2355: %% for the system to update the display before we enter more
 2356: %% commands.
 2357: shell_history(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2358:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "basic"),
 2359:     rtnode:run(
 2360:       [{putline, "echo1."},
 2361:        {expect, "echo1\r\n"},
 2362:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2363:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"},
 2364:        {putline, "echo3."},
 2365:        {expect, "echo3\r\n"},
 2366:        {putline, "echo4."},
 2367:        {expect, "echo4\r\n"},
 2368:        {putline, "echo5."},
 2369:        {expect, "echo5\r\n"}
 2370:       ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2371:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 2372:     rtnode:run(
 2373:       [{sleep,100},
 2374:        {putline, ""},
 2375:        %% the init:stop that stopped the node is dropped
 2376:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo5[.]$"},
 2377:        {putdata, [$\n]},
 2378:        {expect, "echo5\r\n"},
 2379:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo5[.]$"},
 2380:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo4[.]$"},
 2381:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo3[.]$"},
 2382:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$"},
 2383:        {putdata, [$\^n]}, {expect, "echo3[.]$"},
 2384:        {putdata, [$\^n]}, {expect, "echo4[.]$"},
 2385:        {putdata, [$\^b]}, {sleep,50}, %% the echo4. (cursor moved one left)
 2386:        {putline, ["ECHO"]},
 2387:        {expect, "echo4ECHO\r\n"}
 2388:       ], [], [],
 2389:       mk_history_param(Path)),
 2390:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 2391: 
 2392:     %% ignore input given after io:get_line, and after h(module) pager
 2393:     rtnode:run(
 2394:        [{putdata, "io:get_line(\"getline>\").\n"},
 2395:         {expect, "getline>"},
 2396:         {putline, "hej"}, {expect, "hej\r\n"},
 2397:         {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "\\Qio:get_line(\"getline>\")\\E[.]$"}
 2398:        ], [], [],
 2399:        mk_history_param(Path)),
 2400:     ok.
 2401: 
 2402: shell_history_resize(Config) ->
 2403:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "resize"),
 2404:     rtnode:run(
 2405:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2406:        {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2407:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2408:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"}
 2409:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history_file_bytes","123456"] ++
 2410:           mk_history_param(Path)),
 2411: 
 2412:     {ok, Logs} =
 2413:         rtnode:run(
 2414:           [{sleep,100},
 2415:            {putline, ""},
 2416:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$$"},
 2417:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2418:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2419:            {expect, "echo"}
 2420:           ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history_file_bytes","654321"] ++
 2421:               mk_history_param(Path)),
 2422: 
 2423:     rtnode:check_logs(
 2424:       "erlang.log.1",
 2425:       "The configured log history file size is different from the size "
 2426:       "of the log file on disk", Logs),
 2427: 
 2428:     ok.
 2429: 
 2430: shell_history_eaccess(Config) ->
 2431:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "eaccess"),
 2432:     file:make_dir(filename:dirname(Path)),
 2433:     ok = file:make_dir(Path),
 2434:     {ok, Info} = file:read_file_info(Path),
 2435:     try
 2436:         NoExecMode = Info#file_info.mode band (bnot 8#111),
 2437:         file:write_file_info(Path,Info#file_info{ mode = NoExecMode }),
 2438: 
 2439:         %% Cannot create history log in folder
 2440:         {ok, Logs1} =
 2441:             rtnode:run(
 2442:               [{putline, "echo."},
 2443:                {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2444:               ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2445: 
 2446:         ct:log("~p",[Logs1]),
 2447:         rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Error handling file", Logs1),
 2448: 
 2449:         %% shell_docs recursively creates the folder to store the
 2450:         %% logs. This test checks that erlang still starts if we
 2451:         %% cannot create the folders to the path.
 2452:         {ok, Logs2} =
 2453:             rtnode:run(
 2454:               [{putline, "echo."},
 2455:                {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2456:               ], [], [], mk_history_param(filename:join(Path,"logs"))),
 2457: 
 2458:         rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Error handling file", Logs2)
 2459: 
 2460:     after
 2461:         file:write_file_info(Path, Info)
 2462:     end,
 2463:     ok.
 2464: 
 2465: shell_history_repair(Config) ->
 2466:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "repair"),
 2467: 
 2468:     %% We stop a node without closing the log
 2469:     shell_history_halt(Path),
 2470: 
 2471:     {ok, Logs} =
 2472:         rtnode:run(
 2473:           [{putline, ""},
 2474:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2475:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2476:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2477:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2478: 
 2479:     %% The regexp below checks that he string is NOT part of the log
 2480:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1",
 2481:                       "The shell history log file was corrupted and was repaired",
 2482:                       false,
 2483:                       Logs),
 2484:     ok.
 2485: 
 2486: shell_history_repair_corrupt(Config) ->
 2487:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "repair_corrupt"),
 2488: 
 2489:     %% We stop a node without closing the log
 2490:     shell_history_halt(Path),
 2491: 
 2492:     %% We corrupt the disklog
 2493:     {ok, D} = file:open(filename:join(Path,"erlang-shell-log.1"), [read,append]),
 2494:     ok = file:write(D, [10,10]),
 2495:     ok = file:close(D),
 2496: 
 2497:     {ok, Logs} =
 2498:         rtnode:run(
 2499:           [{putline, ""},
 2500:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2501:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2502:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2503:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2504: 
 2505:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1",
 2506:                       "The shell history log file was corrupted and was repaired.",
 2507:                       Logs),
 2508:     ok.
 2509: 
 2510: shell_history_corrupt(Config) ->
 2511:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "corrupt"),
 2512: 
 2513:     %% We initialize the shell history log with a known value.
 2514:     rtnode:run(
 2515:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2516:        {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2517:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2518:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"}
 2519:       ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2520: 
 2521:     %% We corrupt the disklog.
 2522:     {ok, D} = file:open(filename:join(Path,"erlang-shell-log.1"), [read, append]),
 2523:     ok = file:write(D, [10, 10]),
 2524:     ok = file:close(D),
 2525: 
 2526:     {ok, Logs} =
 2527:         rtnode:run(
 2528:           [{putline, ""},
 2529:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$"},
 2530:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2531:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2532:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2533:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2534: 
 2535:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Invalid chunk in the file", Logs),
 2536:     ok.
 2537: 
 2538: %% Stop the node without closing the log.
 2539: shell_history_halt(Path) ->
 2540:     try
 2541:         rtnode:run(
 2542:           [{putline, "echo."},
 2543:            {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2544:            {sleep, 2500}, % disk_log internal cache timer is 2000 ms
 2545:            {putline, "halt(0)."},
 2546:            {expect, "\r\n"},
 2547:            {sleep, 1000} %% wait for node to terminate
 2548:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path))
 2549:     catch
 2550:         _:_ ->
 2551:             ok
 2552:     end.
 2553: 
 2554: shell_history_path(Config, TestCase) ->
 2555:     filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2556:                    "shell_history", TestCase]).
 2557: 
 2558: mk_history_param(Path) ->
 2559:     ["-kernel","shell_history","enabled",
 2560:      "-kernel","shell_history_path","\"" ++ Path ++ "\"",
 2561:      "-kernel","shell_history_drop","[\"init:stop().\"]"
 2562:     ].
 2563: 
 2564: shell_history_custom(_Config) ->
 2565:     %% Up key: Ctrl + P = Cp=[$\^p]
 2566:     rtnode:run(
 2567:       [{expect, "1> $"},
 2568:        %% {putline, ""},
 2569:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "0[.]"},
 2570:        {putdata, [$\n]},
 2571:        {expect, "0\r\n"},
 2572:        {putline, "echo."},
 2573:        {expect, "!echo\r\n"} % exclamation mark is printed by custom history module
 2574:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2575:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2576:     ok.
 2577: 
 2578: shell_history_custom_errors(_Config) ->
 2579: 
 2580:     %% Check that we can start with a node with an undefined
 2581:     %% provider module.
 2582:     rtnode:run(
 2583:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2584:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2585:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history","very_broken",
 2586:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2587: 
 2588:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2589:     %% that crashes in load/0.
 2590:     rtnode:run(
 2591:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2592:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2593:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2594:                   "-kernel","provider_load","crash",
 2595:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2596: 
 2597:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2598:     %% that return incorrect in load/0.
 2599:     rtnode:run(
 2600:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2601:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2602:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2603:                   "-kernel","provider_load","badreturn",
 2604:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2605: 
 2606:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2607:     %% that crashes in load/0.
 2608:     rtnode:run(
 2609:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2610:        {expect, "(Disabling shell history logging.|echo)"},
 2611:        {expect, "(Disabling shell history logging.|echo)"}
 2612:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2613:                   "-kernel","provider_add","crash",
 2614:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2615: 
 2616:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2617:     %% that return incorrect in load/0.
 2618:     rtnode:run(
 2619:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2620:        {expect, "It returned {error,badreturn}.\r\n"},
 2621:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2622:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2623:                   "-kernel","provider_add","badreturn",
 2624:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2625: 
 2626:     ok.
 2627: 
 2628: shell_history_toggle(_Config) ->
 2629: 
 2630:     %% Check that we can start with a node with an undefined
 2631:     %% provider module.
 2632:     rtnode:run(
 2633:       [
 2634:        {putline, "io:setopts(user, [{line_history, true}])."},
 2635:        {expect, "{error,enotsup}\r\n"},
 2636: 
 2637:        %% Test that io:get_line does not save into history buffer
 2638:        {putline, ~s'io:get_line("").'},
 2639:        {putline, ~s'hello'},
 2640:        {expect, ~s'\\Q"hello\\n"\r\n\\E'},
 2641:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, %% Up key
 2642:        {expect, ~s'\\Qio:get_line("").\\E'},
 2643:        {putdata, [$\^n]},  %% Down key
 2644:        {expect, ~s'> $'},
 2645: 
 2646:        %% Test that io:get_line does save into history buffer when enabled
 2647:        {putline, "io:setopts([{line_history, true}])."},
 2648:        {expect, "ok\r\n"},
 2649:        {putline, ~s'io:get_line("> ").'},
 2650:        {putline, ~s'hello again'},
 2651:        {expect, ~s'\\Q"hello again\\n"\r\n\\E'},
 2652:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, %% Up key
 2653:        {expect, ~s'hello again'},
 2654:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, %% Up key
 2655:        {expect, ~s'\\Qio:get_line("> ").\\E'},
 2656:        {putdata, [$\^n]},  %% Down key
 2657:        {expect, ~s'hello again'},
 2658:        {putdata, [$\^n]},  %% Down key
 2659:        {expect, ~s'> $'},
 2660: 
 2661:        %% Test that io:get_line does not save into history buffer when disabled
 2662:        {putline, "io:setopts([{line_history, false}])."},
 2663:        {putline, ~s'io:get_line("| ").'},
 2664:        {putline, ~s'hello'},
 2665:        {expect, ~s'\\Q"hello\\n"\r\n\\E'},
 2666:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, %% Up key
 2667:        {expect, ~s'\\Qio:get_line("| ").\\E'},
 2668:        {putdata, [$\^n]},  %% Down key
 2669:        {expect, ~s'> $'}
 2670:       ], [], [], ["-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2671: 
 2672:         ok.
 2673: 
 2674: load() ->
 2675:     case application:get_env(kernel,provider_load) of
 2676:         {ok, crash} ->
 2677:             error(crash);
 2678:         {ok, badreturn} ->
 2679:             %% Should return a list of string()
 2680:             ok;
 2681:         _ ->
 2682:             ["0.\n\n"]
 2683:     end.
 2684: 
 2685: add(_Line) ->
 2686:     case application:get_env(kernel,provider_add) of
 2687:         {ok, crash} ->
 2688:             error(crash);
 2689:         {ok, badreturn} ->
 2690:             %% Should return ok
 2691:             {error, badreturn};
 2692:         _ ->
 2693:             io:format("!", [])
 2694:     end.
 2695: 
 2696: %% Tests that local shell can be started by means of job control.
 2697: job_control_local(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2698:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2699: 	old ->
 2700: 	    %% Old shell tests
 2701: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2702: 	new ->
 2703: 	    %% New shell tests
 2704: 	    rtnode:run(
 2705:               [{putline, ""},
 2706:                {expect,  "1> $"},
 2707:                {putline, "2."},
 2708:                {expect,  "\r\n2\r\n"},
 2709:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2710:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2711:                {putline, "s"},
 2712:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2713:                {putline, "c"},
 2714:                {expect,  "\r\nEshell"},
 2715:                {expect,  "1> $"},
 2716:                {putline, "35."},
 2717:                {expect,  "\r\n35\r\n"},
 2718:                {expect,  "2> $"},
 2719:                {putline, "receive M -> M end.\r\n"},
 2720:                {sleep, 6000},
 2721:                {expect, "Command is taking a long time"},
 2722:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2723:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2724:                {putline, "i 3"},
 2725:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2726:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2727:                {putline, "i 2"},
 2728:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2729:                {putline, "c"},
 2730:                {expect,  "[*][*] exception exit: killed"},
 2731:                {expect,  "[23]>"},
 2732:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2733:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2734:                {putline, "k 3"},
 2735:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2736:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2737:                {putline, "k 2"},
 2738:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2739:                {putline, "k"},
 2740:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2741:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2742:                {putline, "c"},
 2743:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2744:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2745:                {putline, "i"},
 2746:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2747:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2748:                {putline, "?"},
 2749:                {expect,  "this message"},
 2750:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2751:                {putline, "h"},
 2752:                {expect,  "this message"},
 2753:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2754:                {putdata, "\t"}, %% Test that we don't crash
 2755:                {sleep, 100},
 2756:                {putline, ""},
 2757:                {expect,  "^\r\n\r\n --> $"},
 2758:                {putdata, "\^r"}, %% Test that we don't crash
 2759:                {sleep, 100},
 2760:                {putline, ""},
 2761:                {expect,  "^\r\n\r\n --> $"},
 2762:                {putline, "c 1"},
 2763:                {expect, "\r\n"},
 2764:                {putline, "35."},
 2765:                {expect, "\r\n35\r\n"},
 2766:                {expect, "[23]> $"}
 2767:               ]),
 2768:             ok
 2769:     end.
 2770: 
 2771: %% Tests that remote shell can be started by means of job control.
 2772: job_control_remote(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2773:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2774: 	old ->
 2775: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2776: 	_ ->
 2777:             {ok, Peer, NSNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{ args => ["-connect_all","false"],
 2778:                                              peer_down => continue }),
 2779:             try
 2780:                 test_remote_job_control(NSNode)
 2781:             after
 2782:                 peer:stop(Peer)
 2783:             end
 2784:     end.
 2785: 
 2786: %% Tests that remote shell can be started by means of job control to
 2787: %% -noshell node.
 2788: job_control_remote_noshell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2789:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2790: 	old ->
 2791: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2792: 	_ ->
 2793: 	    {ok, Peer, NSNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{ name => peer:random_name(test_remote_job_control),
 2794:                                              args => ["-connect_all","false","-noshell"],
 2795:                                              peer_down => continue }),
 2796:             try
 2797:                 test_remote_job_control(NSNode)
 2798:             after
 2799:                 peer:stop(Peer)
 2800:             end
 2801:     end.
 2802: 
 2803: test_remote_job_control(Node) ->
 2804:     RemNode = peer:random_name(test_remote_job_control),
 2805:     Pid = spawn_link(Node, fun() ->
 2806:                                    receive die ->
 2807:                                            ok
 2808:                                    end
 2809:                            end),
 2810:     PidStr = erpc:call(Node, erlang, pid_to_list, [Pid]),
 2811:     true = erpc:call(Node, erlang, register, [kalaskula,Pid]),
 2812:     PrintedNode = printed_atom(Node),
 2813:     CookieString = printed_atom(erlang:get_cookie()),
 2814: 
 2815:     rtnode:run(
 2816:       [{putline, ""},
 2817:        {putline, "erlang:get_cookie()."},
 2818:        {expect, "\r\n\\Q" ++ CookieString ++ "\\E"},
 2819:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2820:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2821:        {putline, "r " ++ PrintedNode},
 2822:        {expect, "\r\n"},
 2823:        {putline, "j"},
 2824:        {expect, "1  {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2825:        {expect, "2[*] {\\Q"++PrintedNode++"\\E,shell,start,\\[]}"},
 2826:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2827:        {putline, "c"},
 2828:        {expect, "\r\n"},
 2829:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2830:        {expect, "\\Q(" ++ atom_to_list(Node) ++")1> \\E$"},
 2831:        {putline, "whereis(kalaskula)."},
 2832:        {expect, PidStr},
 2833:        {putline, "kalaskula ! die."},
 2834:        {putline, "exit()."},
 2835:        {expect, "[*][*][*] Shell process terminated!"},
 2836:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2837:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2838:        {putline, "j"},
 2839:        {expect, "1  {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2840:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2841:        {putline, "c"},
 2842:        {expect, "Unknown job"},
 2843:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2844:        {putline, "c 1"},
 2845:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[12]> $"},
 2846:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2847:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2848:        {putline, "j"},
 2849:        {expect, "1[*] {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2850:        {putline, "c"},
 2851:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[123]> $"},
 2852:        {sleep, 100},
 2853:        {putline, "35."},
 2854:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[123]> $"}
 2855:       ], RemNode),
 2856:     Pid ! die,
 2857:     ok.
 2858: 
 2859: %% Tests various control keys.
 2860: ctrl_keys(_Config) ->
 2861:     Cu = [$\^u],
 2862:     Cw = [$\^w],
 2863:     Cy = [$\^y],
 2864:     Home = [27,$O,$H],
 2865:     End = [27,$O,$F],
 2866:     rtnode:run(
 2867:       [{putline,""},
 2868:        {putline,"2."},
 2869:        {expect,"2"},
 2870:        {putline,"\"hello "++Cw++"world\"."},	% test <CTRL>+W
 2871:        {expect,"\"world\""},
 2872:        {putline,"\"hello "++Cu++"\"world\"."},	% test <CTRL>+U
 2873:        {expect,"\"world\""},
 2874:        {putline,"world\"."++Home++"\"hello "},	% test <HOME>
 2875:        {expect,"\"hello world\""},
 2876:        {putline,"world"++Home++"\"hello "++End++"\"."},	% test <END>
 2877:        {expect,"\"hello world\""},
 2878:        {putline,"\"hello world\""++Cu++Cy++"."},
 2879:        {expect,"\"hello world\""}] ++
 2880:           wordLeft() ++ wordRight()),
 2881:     ok.
 2882: 
 2883: wordLeft() ->
 2884:     L1 = "\e\e[D",
 2885:     L2 = "\e[5D",
 2886:     L3 = "\e[1;5D",
 2887:     wordLeft(L1) ++ wordLeft(L2) ++ wordLeft(L3).
 2888: 
 2889: wordLeft(Chars) ->
 2890:     End = "\eOF",
 2891:     [{putline,"\"world\""++Chars++"hello "++End++"."},
 2892:      {expect,"\"hello world\""}].
 2893: 
 2894: wordRight() ->
 2895:     R1 = "\e\e[C",
 2896:     R2 = "\e[5C",
 2897:     R3 = "\e[1;5C",
 2898:     wordRight(R1) ++ wordRight(R2) ++ wordRight(R3).
 2899: 
 2900: wordRight(Chars) ->
 2901:     Home = "\eOH",
 2902:     [{putline,"world"++Home++"\"hello "++Chars++"\"."},
 2903:      {expect,"\"hello world\""}].
 2904: 
 2905: %% Test that -remsh works
 2906: remsh_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2907:     {ok, Peer, TargetNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
 2908:     TargetNodeStr = printed_atom(TargetNode),
 2909:     [_Name,Host] = string:split(atom_to_list(node()), "@"),
 2910: 
 2911:     PreCmds = [{putline,""},
 2912:                {putline,"node()."},
 2913:                {expect, "\\Q" ++ TargetNodeStr ++ "\\E\r\n"}],
 2914: 
 2915:     PostCmds = quit_hosting_node(),
 2916: 
 2917:     %% Test that remsh works with explicit -sname.
 2918:     HostNode = atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ "_host",
 2919:     HostNodeStr = printed_atom(list_to_atom(HostNode ++ "@" ++ Host)),
 2920:     rtnode:run(
 2921:       PreCmds ++
 2922:           [{putline,"nodes()."},
 2923:            {expect, "\\Q" ++ HostNodeStr ++ "\\E"}] ++
 2924:           PostCmds,
 2925:       HostNode, " ", "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr),
 2926: 
 2927:     %% Test that remsh works without -sname.
 2928:     rtnode:run(PreCmds ++ PostCmds, [], " ", "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr),
 2929: 
 2930:     %% Test that if multiple remsh are given, we select the first
 2931:     rtnode:run([{expect, "Multiple"}] ++ PreCmds ++ PostCmds,
 2932:                [], " ",
 2933:                "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr ++ " -remsh invalid_node"),
 2934: 
 2935:     peer:stop(Peer),
 2936: 
 2937:     ok.
 2938: 
 2939: %% Test that if we cannot connect to a node, we get a correct error
 2940: remsh_error(_Config) ->
 2941:     "Could not connect to \"invalid_node\"\n" =
 2942:         os:cmd(ct:get_progname() ++ " -remsh invalid_node").
 2943: 
 2944: quit_hosting_node() ->
 2945:     %% Command sequence for entering a shell on the hosting node.
 2946:     [{putdata, "\^g"},
 2947:      {expect, "--> $"},
 2948:      {putline, "s"},
 2949:      {expect, "--> $"},
 2950:      {putline, "c"},
 2951:      {expect, ["Eshell"]},
 2952:      {expect, ["1> $"]}].
 2953: 
 2954: %% Test that -remsh works with long names.
 2955: remsh_longnames(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2956:     %% If we cannot resolve the domain, we need to add localhost to the longname
 2957:     Domain =
 2958:         case inet_db:res_option(domain) of
 2959:             [] ->
 2960:                 "@127.0.0.1";
 2961:             _ -> ""
 2962:         end,
 2963:     Name = peer:random_name(?FUNCTION_NAME),
 2964:     case rtnode:start(" -name " ++ Name ++ Domain) of
 2965:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, SNode, SState} ->
 2966:             try
 2967:                 {ok, _CRPid, CTPid, CNode, CState} =
 2968:                     rtnode:start("-name undefined" ++ Domain ++
 2969:                                      " -remsh " ++ Name),
 2970:                 try
 2971:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2972:                            SNode,
 2973:                            STPid,
 2974:                            [{putline, ""},
 2975:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2976:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"}], 1),
 2977:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2978:                            CNode,
 2979:                            CTPid,
 2980:                            [{putline, ""},
 2981:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2982:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"} | quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2983:                 after
 2984:                     rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(CState))
 2985:                 end
 2986:             after
 2987:                 rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(SState))
 2988:             end;
 2989:         {skip, _} = Else ->
 2990:             Else
 2991:     end.
 2992: 
 2993: %% Test that -remsh works without epmd.
 2994: remsh_no_epmd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2995:     EPMD_ARGS = "-start_epmd false -erl_epmd_port 12346 ",
 2996:     Name = ?CT_PEER_NAME(),
 2997:     case rtnode:start([],"ERL_EPMD_PORT=12345 ",
 2998:                       EPMD_ARGS ++ " -sname " ++ Name) of
 2999:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, SNode, SState} ->
 3000:             try
 3001:                 ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 3002:                        SNode,
 3003:                        STPid,
 3004:                        [{putline, ""},
 3005:                         {putline, "node()."},
 3006:                         {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"}], 1),
 3007:                 {ok, _CRPid, CTPid, CNode, CState} =
 3008:                     rtnode:start([],"ERL_EPMD_PORT=12345 ",
 3009:                                  EPMD_ARGS ++ " -remsh "++Name),
 3010:                 try
 3011:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 3012:                            CNode,
 3013:                            CTPid,
 3014:                            [{putline, ""},
 3015:                             {putline, "node()."},
 3016:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"} | quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 3017:                 after
 3018:                     rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(CState))
 3019:                 end
 3020:             after
 3021:                 rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(SState))
 3022:             end;
 3023:         {skip, _} = Else ->
 3024:             Else
 3025:     end.
 3026: remsh_expand_compatibility_25(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3027:     {ok, _Peer, TargetNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{}), %% Create a vsn 26 node
 3028:     NodeName = atom_to_list(TargetNode), %% compatibility
 3029:     %% Start a node on vsn 25 but run the shell on vsn 26
 3030:     case rtnode:start(peer:random_name(), "stty columns 200; ERL_AFLAGS= ", "-remsh "++NodeName, [{release, "25"}|Config]) of
 3031:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, _, SState} ->
 3032:             try
 3033:                 ok = rtnode:send_commands(undefined,
 3034:                        STPid,
 3035:                        [{putdata, "erlang:is_atom\t"},
 3036:                         {expect, "\\Qerlang:is_atom(\\E"}|
 3037:                         quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 3038:             after
 3039:                 Logs = rtnode:stop(SState),
 3040:                 rtnode:dump_logs(Logs)
 3041:             end;
 3042:         Else when element(1, Else) =/= ok -> Else
 3043:     end.
 3044: remsh_expand_compatibility_later_version(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3045:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 3046:     case ?CT_PEER_REL([], "25", PrivDir) of
 3047:         not_available -> {skip, "25 not available"};
 3048:         {ok, _Peer, TargetNode}  ->
 3049:             NodeName = atom_to_list(TargetNode),
 3050:             %% Start a node on later version but run the shell on vsn 25
 3051:             case rtnode:start(peer:random_name(), "stty columns 200; ERL_AFLAGS= ", "-remsh " ++ NodeName, Config) of
 3052:                 {ok, _SRPid, STPid, _, SState} ->
 3053:                     try
 3054:                         ok = rtnode:send_commands(undefined,
 3055:                             STPid,
 3056:                             [{putdata, "erlang:is_atom\t"},
 3057:                              {expect, "\\Qerlang:is_atom(\\E"}|
 3058:                              quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 3059:                     after
 3060:                         Logs = rtnode:stop(SState),
 3061:                         rtnode:dump_logs(Logs)
 3062:                     end;
 3063:                 Else when element(1, Else) =/= ok -> Else
 3064:             end
 3065:     end.
 3066: 
 3067: printed_atom(A) ->
 3068:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~w", [A])).
